bug.summary: Patchy gradcheck for ConvQuadInterp3d on GPU
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Whilst working on a PR I found that the TestConvQuadInterp3d.test_gradcheck test case would often fail on the GPU device, especially when run multiple times. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: >>> import kornia >>> import torch >>> import kornia.testing as utils >>> from torch.autograd import gradcheck >>> for _ in range(10): ... input = torch.rand(1, 2, 3, 5, 5).to('cuda') ... input = utils.tensor_to_gradcheck_var(input) # to var ... assert gradcheck(kornia.geometry.ConvQuadInterp3d(), ... (input), raise_exception=True) ... Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 5, in <module> File "/media/aiden/LinuxData/Clones/kornia/.dev_env/envs/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 297, in gradcheck 'The tolerance for nondeterminism was {}.'.format(nondet_tol)) File "/media/aiden/LinuxData/Clones/kornia/.dev_env/envs/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 229, in fail_test raise RuntimeError(msg) RuntimeError: Backward is not reentrant, i.e., running backward with same input and grad_output multiple times gives different values, although analytical gradient matches numerical gradient. The tolerance for nondeterminism was 0.0. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The check should always succeed. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch version: 1.5.0 Is debug build: No CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.2 OS: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS GCC version: (Ubuntu 9.3.0-10ubuntu2) 9.3.0 CMake version: Could not collect Python version: 3.7 Is CUDA available: Yes CUDA runtime version: Could not collect GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 980 Nvidia driver version: 440.64 cuDNN version: Could not collect Versions of relevant libraries: [pip] numpy==1.18.1 [pip] torch==1.5.0 [pip] torchvision==0.6.0a0+82fd1c8 [conda] blas 1.0 mkl [conda] cudatoolkit 10.2.89 hfd86e86_0 [conda] mkl 2020.0 166 [conda] mkl-service 2.3.0 py37he904b0f_0 [conda] mkl_fft 1.0.15 py37ha843d7b_0 [conda] mkl_random 1.1.0 py37hd6b4f25_0 [conda] numpy 1.18.1 py37h4f9e942_0 [conda] numpy-base 1.18.1 py37hde5b4d6_1 [conda] pytorch 1.5.0 py3.7_cuda10.2.89_cudnn7.6.5_0 pytorch [conda] torchvision 0.6.0 py37_cu102 pytorch
